stepTitle: A $$150.0$$ g block of copper at $$80.0\degreeC$$ is placed into $$300.0$$ g of water at $$25.0\degreeC$$. The specific heat capacity of copper is $$0.385$$ J g⁻¹ K⁻¹, and the specific heat capacity of water is $$4.18$$ J g⁻¹ K⁻¹. Assume no heat is lost to the surroundings. Calculate the final temperature (in K) of the system.
stepBody:
Constants:

Specific heat capacity of copper, $$c_{Cu}=0.385$$ J g⁻¹ K⁻¹
Specific heat capacity of water, $$c_{water}=4.18$$ J g⁻¹ K⁻¹

Formula for heat transfer:
$$q=mcΔT$$, where q is the heat energy, $$m$$ is the mass, c is the specific heat capacity, and ΔT is the change in temperature.
Compute your answer in K to the nearest integer.
